byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Houston, and Dave Montgomery from Austin, Tex.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and DAVE MONTGOMERY

abstract: So-called campus-carry bill passed by Republican-dominated Texas Legislature, which will allow students and staff at public and private universities in state to possess concealed handguns on campus, is expected to be signed into law by Gov Greg Abbott; law, which proponents say will make campuses safer, will go into effect in August 2016 at universities and year later at community colleges; critics say law will create climate of fear on campus.
lead_paragraph: The campus-carry bill, expected to be signed by Gov. Greg Abbott, affects licensed gun users at public and private universities.

headline.main: Texas Lawmakers Pass a Bill Allowing Guns at Colleges
headline.print_headline: Texas Lawmakers Pass a Bill Allowing Guns at Colleges

snippet: The campus-carry bill, expected to be signed by Gov. Greg Abbott, affects licensed gun users at public and private universities.
